headline: Nvidia, Dell, and Apple Rally. Tech Goods Has Shifted Assembly.
summary: Shares of tech goods makers rose off their morning lows on news of the high court’s ruling.  Apple, for example, had spent years beefing up its iPhone manufacturing capacity in India, and was able to shift that output to the U.S. In its first quarter, Apple’s products gross profit margin increased by 1.4 percentage points from the year before, despite the tariff headwind.  Apple stock rose 0.6% in midday trading, after being down as much as 0.9%.

Apple stock rose 0.6% in midday trading, after being down as much as 0.9%.

headline: OpenAI developing AI devices including smart speaker, The Information reports
summary: OpenAI has more than 200 people working on a family of AI-powered ‌devices that will include a smart speaker ‌and possibly smart glasses and a smart lamp, the Information reported ​on Friday, citing a person with knowledge of the plans.  The smart speaker, the first device OpenAI will launch, is likely to be priced between $200 and $300, the ‌report said, citing ⁠two people with knowledge of it.  The ​smart glasses likely would ‌not be ready for mass production until 2028, the report said.

raw.headline: OpenAI developing AI devices including smart speaker, The Information reports
raw.summary: OpenAI has more than 200 people working on a family of AI-powered ‌devices that will include a smart speaker ‌and possibly smart glasses and a smart lamp, the Information reported ​on Friday, citing a person with knowledge of the plans.  The smart speaker, the first device OpenAI will launch, is likely to be priced between $200 and $300, the ‌report said, citing ⁠two people with knowledge of it.  The ​smart glasses likely would ‌not be ready for mass production until 2028, the report said.

headline: AI Spending Boom Likely Has Erased This Key Supporting Plank for Stock Performance
summary: The largest U.S. tech companies are on pace to spend about as much money as it cost to build the domestic railroads, around five times the amount needed to create a federal highway system, and 10 times the cash needed to put a man on the moon.  The so-called Big Four hyperscalers—  Microsoft Alphabet Meta Platforms  and  Amazon.com  —are forecast to spend at least $600 billion on artificial-intelligence buildouts in 2026.  Add  Oracle  projected spending and the tally rises to $650 billion, a near 60% increase from 2025 levels.

raw.headline: AI Spending Boom Likely Has Erased This Key Supporting Plank for Stock Performance
raw.summary: The largest U.S. tech companies are on pace to spend about as much money as it cost to build the domestic railroads, around five times the amount needed to create a federal highway system, and 10 times the cash needed to put a man on the moon.  The so-called Big Four hyperscalers—  Microsoft Alphabet Meta Platforms  and  Amazon.com  —are forecast to spend at least $600 billion on artificial-intelligence buildouts in 2026.  Add  Oracle  projected spending and the tally rises to $650 billion, a near 60% increase from 2025 levels.
